result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Timothy T. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work/full time school or a combination and when not fully enganged must complete 15 hours of community servicer per week.
No contact with victims: T.B. & D.S.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

DNA Sample

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.

File an Amended Information.
Ct. 1>> Dismiss 'Use of a Dangerous Weapon' Enhancer.
Ct. 2 (2nd Degree Reckless Injury-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>DRI.
Add 3 Counts of (Battery-Use of a Dangerous Weapon) pursuant to 940.19(1) & 939.63(1)(b).
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Reckless Injury)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Battery-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Reckless Injury)>>   COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 3 Years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1.
Court has 3 days credit if revoked.

DEOJ RH>> 4/19/2020 @ 9:00 am
Bond continues.

Ct. 3 (Battery-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, CONCURRENT. CONDITIONS: Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with Victims T.B. & D.S., Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court has 3 days credit if revoked.
